When I start Eclipse-I200403230800, from the command-line I get the following 
output.  Nothing appears, and there is nothing in the log.  This is preventing 
me from working.

This has been fixed for the 12:00 rebuild.
However this is not the source of your problem.
If you don't want to wait for the rebuild to be available, check out 
org.eclipse.platform.

Pascal: this is not the "ui.forms" problem; this is a separate issue.  Are you 
sure that the issue I describe has been fixed?

Created an attachment (id=8791)
Stack trace

This is the stack trace I get if I start a fresh workspace on I20040322 (0800)

John this is not the same pb than the one Doug is reporting. This was due to a 
problem in ui.forms which has been fixed.

Yes Doug this has been fixed.

This is a problem in two places.  First of all, intro shouldn't require the  
browser widget to start Eclipse.  And SWT says that:  "You need the Mozilla  
version 1.4 GTK2 (or above 1.4)."  I have Mozilla 1.6 installed, and this fails  
to start-up.

Chrix to get to the bottom of this.

For the first two builds, Intro extension has been configured to launch HTML 
widget for win32 and linux gtk, otherwise default to Eclipse Forms-based 
intro. 

For the subsequent builds, we will catch exceptions and automatically switch 
to the next implementation if the desired one fails (we might add an entry in 
the log though).
*** Bug 55726 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
This is not fixed in the 200403231208 build.
Dejan: could you clarify -- which build will this be fixed in?

As a workaround, I found that you can create the file
$WORKSPACE/.metadata/.plugins/org.eclipse.ui.ide/prefs.ini with the
following contents:

#Tue Mar 23 10:59:23 PST 2004
/instance/org.eclipse.ui.ide/INTRO=false
We will turn the HTML implementation of the intro off for 4pm build.

Doug is using the gentoo linux distribution with Mozilla 1.6 GTK2 in 
the /usr/lib/mozilla directory without the /etc/gre.conf file. After following 
the instructions in the SWT FAQ (link below) for unsupported distributions, 
the Browser came up fine.
-What do I need to run the SWT Browser on Linux GTK or Linux Motif? 
http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/index.cgi/%7Echeckout%7E/platform-swt-
home/faq.html#browserlinux

Moving to Help. Eclipse should handle the case where the Browser cannot be 
instantiated without crashing.
This is Intro not Help.  Moving to UI.

We will resolve this problem in two ways:

1) Only use HTML widget on Windows for now (this code is in 4pm build)
2) Have a drop-through mechanism for picking the first intro implementation 
that does not throw an SWTError. This will allow us to try HTML presentation 
first and fall back to SWT default implementation if the browser widget cannot 
be instantiated for whatever reason. This code will be in one of the future 
builds.

I20040324 (Wed, 24 Mar 2004 -- 00:10 (-0500) )
Fixed as of the above Integration build.

Long story short, Intro use of SWT Browser on Linux is now turned off. 
But even when turned on, we now degrade more nicely, just like Dejan said. So 
if for any reason, the SWT Browser fails (even on Win32) we degrade to UI 
forms implmentation.
Some even like the 'degraded' version more :-).
